conclusion: Analyze current shadow positions and understand principles of shadow formation.
Shadow A is cast by the glove.
Shadow B is cast by the ring.
Shadow C is cast by the bulletin board.
Shadow D is cast by the postcard and cylinder.
Shadows are cast towards the front of the image, indicating light source is behind the objects.
If light source moves to back left, shadows shift to right side of objects.
Shadows become larger when light source moves to back left due to increased angle.
If light source moves to back right, shadows shift to left side of objects.
Shadows become larger when light source moves to back right due to increased angle.
When light source moves to back left, shadows A, B, C, and D move to right and become larger.
When light source moves to back right, shadows A, B, C, and D move to left and become larger.
